website_summaries.verdict: A suitable mini trampoline for beginning exercisers with bonus features that make it even more fun to use.
pros: Attachable resistance bands for toning and monitor to track number of jumps, workout time, and calories
cons: Resistance bands may not be as durable in high-intensity workouts

customer_reviews.title: I am very discouraged with the quality of the trampoline ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very discouraged with the quality of the trampoline. I received it in March and I only use it three times a week. I can not believe it has been damaged in such a short time. Here I leave a photo of evidence. I wonder if I receive a warranty for damage or replace it with another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Exerciser
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size. Bouncing well & appreciate the hand-held resistance bands. Like that it has bands not springs as I think it's easier on my feet. Would highly recommend to anyone for light bouncing to energize your lymph system or to get your cells moving! Light enough to carry from room-to-room. Instructions say two people needed to unfold. I ended up taking to my Physical Therapist's office - 4 of us ladies couldn't do it. We asked a guy to help & even he had a little trouble before he was able to get it unfolded & locked into place. Not going to ever try to fold up <smile>!
customer_reviews.author: oz67401

customer_reviews.title: DANGER AVOID THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: DANGER!!! Do not buy this item.I narrowly missed being blinded by the rubber band as the stiching gave way and it struck me in my right eye. Thankfully I wear glasses so I can still see. I can’t speak for the trampoline as I am not taking a risk on the stiching of the bands around the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Ariom

customer_reviews.title: Good for lighter weight...
customer_reviews.text: Good trampoline for kids....I got this for myself and for my kids to use, the max weight is 250. I am about 215 and it doesn't work very well for someone my size. There isn't much bounce back when you jump, and you feel like you are going straight to the floor. So i have not been using this, but my kids LOVE it, they love using the counter to see who can get more jumps, and the bounce back for them is fine. So i wouldn't recommend this to someone over 200 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Small woman, I put it together myself
customer_reviews.text: I put it together myself. All I did was straddled each end while wearing sneakers and it snapped together once it reached the opening position. It's almost too good to be true, considering all the review I read. I'm surprised the instructions would suggest using your hands, knowing the risk of the trampoline aka boobies trap would snap in your face. I had no problem. No additional securing was required. The hardest part for me was securing the padding around circumstance. I'll update review after using the trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly small (4'11'' 110lbs) and I love this trampoline! I run on it for cardio. At my weight it feels very supportive and it is a good size to fit in my apartment. Suuuppper hard to open up but maybe that's because my upper body isn't that strong. Haven't collapsed it since I got it and don't look forward to when I'll need to. The legs do seem to come a bit loose after a few uses but that's just a quick 2 second fix before the next time I use it. Also.. my cats love to lay on it.. it's a win for us all!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda PachecoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: it's like jumping on the ground
customer_reviews.text: This rebounder i got on the Prime sale that sold off a bunch of junk, which is what this is. It's so tight, it's like jumping on the ground, there is no rebound whatsoever. It's outside now, i use it as an elevated dog bed.
customer_reviews.author: MountainMama

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars - don't buy if you think you want to fold
customer_reviews.text: CONS 1. not enough bounce to be effective. as others have said, watch a video of rebounder exercises and see how much bounce they have. this is like jumping on the sidewalk. 2. takes 2 people to open 3. legs stop turning but aren't all the way in (see images). jump on it with the leg not all the way in and it's a death trap. 4. since it takes 2 people to open and about 45 minutes to screw the legs in all the way, it's inconvenient to fold for storage. PROS none - it's going back
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Look for better quality
customer_reviews.text: Terrible foldable bear trap, no springs deadening bounce, better to jump on door mats, I used rebounders for 20 plus years and the uplifting bounce is the reason to buy one for this uplifting exciting bounce allows every part of your body to relax and release before flying again up again, foldable nice idea if you want to risk life and limb, there are other options with bouncy springs or very spring cords but this one not, if the makers improve the bounce and make a way to loosen and tighten up the mat separately from folding and it may become great
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to exercise!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! If anyone is looking for exercise options that are helpful for your joints, check into rebounding. Just 10 minutes on this thing feels like the equivalent of running a mile! Very energizing, and there are SO many video tutorials on Youtube for those of you who don't just want to jump.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R.

customer_reviews.title: Came broken and with several missing parts. Missing half ...
customer_reviews.text: Came broken and with several missing parts. Missing half of the rubber bottoms for the legs. The cover for around the edge was full of dirt and with chew marks from rats or something. There was not even enough of it left to place on the item we had to throw it away. I don't know if this was in someone's attic a while or what. And filthy / covered in dirt. I expected used. But not junked.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schindele

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, broke after 3 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 bands have broken off in the last 2 weeks. We've had this for 3 months!!! The company says the warranty for parts is 90 days. We are just passed that, so we lose I guess. Will NEVER buy another Stamina product again. The first one we had lasted 4 years. This was only used by my 90 pound autistic daughter and the weight limit is 250! Very poor quality. But really, what was I expecting for $39?
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelmom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am not an aggressive rebounder and this trampoline is easy to bounce on. I like that it has the digital readout to keep track of # of bounces and time. It is quiet so I can use while hubby is still sleeping in the next room. The only drawback it that you should have 2 people to unfold and fold back up. I did it myself very carefully as other users have commented, by putting my knees on one side and putting weight on the other side slowly going down until it snapped in place. I haven't tried folding it back up yet. Careful if you are doing this on carpet as it may snag it in the springs.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Poynter

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted about six months
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this trampoline, but it broke after about six months. I contacted the supplier asking if they would replace the broken rebounder part, they asked for more information and have not heard back about whether they will replace, even after following up. I used this regularly and enjoyed it, but very disappointed it didn't hold up and have not been able to get a replacement part to get it working again.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the ankles, knees and joints and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I read up on this and thought rebounding would be easier on my joints since I can no longer do Zumba. I watch a number of you tube video and exercise now on this on the days I want some cardio and I love it and work up a great sweat and my recovery is much, much easier.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Potts

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy at max weight
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I read all the reviews and was terrified of being snapped up in it BUT it was very easy to set up. My BF pulled it apart and I stood on one side while he got it fully clicked in. Simple! I love this trampoline! Plenty of space to jump, even if you have big feet! I am close to the max weight and it seems sturdy. I have it in front of the tv and bounce during the show and do high knees for the commercials. 30 and more then usual, 40-50 minutes flies by.
customer_reviews.author: Ravensgirl

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. It comes out of the package like a bear trap and I had not trouble pulling it apart with my 8 year old sitting on one end. The reviews had me worried that it would snap back and kill one of us, but it's really not that bad. Probably could have done it on my own but he wanted to help. Don't think I will be refolding it though. I thought this would be a really easy, laid back kind of work out, but it really gets your heart rate going fast and definitely works you lower body. So far, I'm liking it.
customer_reviews.author: mizzcandi

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money! Look for something else. This trampoline lasted less than 3 months. The cover started ripping out almost immediately. The seams that straps to the jumping surface are letting go and many of the straps are also beginning to fray. It is used maybe an hour a week by a young teen, who weighs less than 90 pounds. We bought this as replacement for a similar model that lasted over 6 years. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: H J

customer_reviews.title: Got me exercising again!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine for me. I was really out of shape but i put this in the spare bedroom, I get up and watch a few minutes of TV while I jog, and I feel so much better. This has really been a game-change for me as far as my health and finally doing something to get in shape. If you are not exercising, buy it. This is an easy way to get started without putting on your track shoes and getting all dressed up and going for a run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really nice although I don’t think is really appropriate for adults. Assembly was easier than I thought... after reading other comments I was very scared so I ask for two guys to open it... it took them only a few seconds... it was a breeze! Do make sure to put on the padding around it before assembling the legs! You’ll regret it if you don’t!
customer_reviews.author: Suly

customer_reviews.title: LOL Got a nice bruise but it worked
customer_reviews.text: Just opening it is the hardest thing you'll ever do in your life. I didn't have anyone to help and it took two hours. Finally I just put it on the slick floor and sat on it, rocking back and forth for it to open little by little. Then it stopped so I just say there for 10 minutes until BAM! it collapsed open and I fell down. LOL Got a nice bruise but it worked!!! The directions say not to do it alone. It could really hurt you if it flipped back into your face or your fingers are in the joints when it goes flat. So be careful! Great quality though!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of putting this together. I like the resistance bands. Overall a nice product. I’m disappointed in the lack of resistance of the trampoline mesh. When I work out I feel like I’m gonna go through it to the floor. If there is an option to improve this model that’s where it needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MS or anyone cardio.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this rebounder! It is a great size (smaller than I used to have, and larger than the "stiff" 30-inch rebounders.) I have MS and use it for cardio, though I "bounce" rather than jump. It has just enough bounce to be good on the joints. It is quiet and pleasant bounce!
customer_reviews.author: Julia LeBoeuf

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long ! It was easy to put together, I Just stood on one side, and pushed down with the other leg ! It is so much fun to use! I sure found muscles that haven't been used in awhile, so I have to do a little bit throughout the day. It won't be to long though before I'll have it mastered.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel

customer_reviews.title: Good budget but but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: Good trampoline for beginners that don’t want to spend a lot of money. The bounce is obviously not as good as a higher quality and may not be comfortable of your heavier. My biggest complaint is the legs. They do not stay tight! They will start squeaking and getting wobbly every 10 min or so and I have to pause my workout to tighten them again it’s really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Helpfulhippo

customer_reviews.title: Won't last
customer_reviews.text: This was my second of these trampolines. The first lasted 8 years and I replaced it after one of the elastic bands broke. This second rebounder I purchased is nowhere near the same quality. I bought it in January and now only 9 months later 4 of the bands have broken and practically all the others have tears in the stitching. The first one I had 1 broken band after 8 years! And in both instance I used the rebounder about 2-3 times a week. Definitely no longer the same quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: I love that it doesn't have Springs but stretchy bands no ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 & 5 year old right after I had another baby. I wanted them to have something to play with and give them a gift so they didn't feel left out. I love that it doesn't have Springs but stretchy bands no more feet legs and hands anything caught or injured by the springs. But the plastic covering that goes over the stretchy bands tears very easily right above the bolts on the outside of the frame that hold the frame together.
customer_reviews.author: ashes72484

customer_reviews.title: Feeling better than Jumpin Jack flash..
customer_reviews.text: I really love this trampoline, it works great as a rebounder! The attached resistance bands are a huge plus, to help me get an arm workout into the mix. As a person who works from home, I use this in 15 minute intervals when I need break and It always makes me feel great!
customer_reviews.author: Lucys World

customer_reviews.title: Makes getting your 10,000 steps a breeze
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite Amazon purchases. I use it every day while I watch educational documentaries on Netflix...improving body and mind in one fell swoop! Afrerwards I eat Reese's Cups and watch Bojack Horseman.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Reviews
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put together and easy enough to use. I did need help to get it unfolded out of the box. The counter only works if you're in the correct position on the trampoline. It's rather bulky and I can't imagine wanting to take it apart for daily storage. It doesn't tuck away nicely into a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful workout! Hard to set up!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and although I didn't think the hand grips were important when I ordered it, I do appreciate the increased stability they give me and increased workout for my upper body. The set up was so difficult, we nearly returned it. The instructions call for 2 strong men to be able to open it and not have anyone suffer physical harm by the rebounder closing back up. It took some time to find a friend with time to help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: then it's a good buy, otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in April, used for 8 months about 3 times a week. One strap (that holds the trampoline to the frame) broke about 3 months after purchase, another broke today. So, if you only plan to use it for a few months, then it's a good buy, otherwise, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for and for a rebounder this was cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the screw-on legs had threads that were machined poorly and were extremely difficult to assemble. They required vice grip pliers and extreme care not to cross thread as well as a lot of force. Once assembled, the rebounder was extremely hard with almost no give. Just one step above bouncing on concrete. Needless to say, I returned it since I was concerned about the shock to my back, knees, and ankles. It might be perfect for somone else but it was a no go for me.
customer_reviews.author: jaw5279

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I use it almost every day
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I use it almost every day. I've had it for a few months and it seems to be holding up nicely. I just put it in front of the television and burn some calories while watching some of my favorite shows. It's a lot cheaper than a treadmill, easier on my joints and easier to store.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just under 2 years ago and used it most every day. The fabric straps just gave way and I am a good 100 lbs below the max rated weight for this. The battery in the little timer has lasted longer than the trampoline. I'm trying to find a replacement cover for this since it seems so wasteful to dump the whole thing in the trash. A previous bouncer I had lasted over 10 years before it broke. I'm thinking about buying a more expensive one for a replacement, but will look elswhere than Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: blank

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble compared to other foldable rebounders
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. It was easy to assemble. The instructions advise two people to assemble but I just used my foot to hold down one side and bith hands on the other to flatten/unfold it without too much effort and it has safety clips to lock i into place. I had previously bought the Marcy foldable one and it was so taut it was impossible even with two of us to unfold so I sent it back. Ive used this tramploine 4 times for 15 minutes with no problems. I have been exercising to youtube rebounder workout videos!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Tried it out and it brings out your inner kid. I know the assembly instructions insists you need two or more people to put it together but I live alone and I continued at my own risk. I assembled this rebounder alone in an hour. The only part you need concern yourself with is extending the trampoline's "catch". There is a concern that this part might spring and snap back while you are extending it resulting in injury or death. If you decide to assemble alone this will be up to you because the instructions insist otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: D.N.A.

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: no impact very good and fast cardio work out. recommended to me. lower body , but has arm resistance also. handy device counts time and reps for you. excellent. you need 2 strong people to assemble. but i did it with ropes and a couple 2x4 pieces of limber. not as hard as i first thought since i am old and weak.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful well made mini tramp for the price. I have never tried rebounding or excersizing with a mini trampoline before but purchasing this has given me a whole new way to get fit while watching tv! Not only that but i can experiment with rebounding techniques which helps drain the lymphatic system and keeps me healthy. Its light weight..easy to put together..and small enuff to stay out all the time. Great bonus is the electronic meter that keeps track of bounces and time etc. An all around great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: gr8mom

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to assemble... I used to work out on stamina when I was younger, totally out of condition and gaining weight, I decided to try this work out again I forgotten how easy it was & how powerful it can be for cardio & weight loss if you are considering this for your workout, you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: urshurt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner rebounder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect beginner rebounder. I recently learned about the benefits of rebounding and decided to purchase one. I have had this for 2 weeks now and it is very study and uses bungee instead of springs which offers more support to the knees and ankles. I have been using this 20 minutes daily for two weeks and feel much better.
customer_reviews.author: ZenLady

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: for under $40, this is worth every penny, it's very well made, sturdy, provides good bounce, but not too much bounce, so you won't hit your head on the ceiling. But next time I probably will get a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: JennyZ

customer_reviews.title: If you have osteoporosis- beware
customer_reviews.text: This baby is sturdy as can be but I’m 60 with osteoporosis in my hips bad and it hurts to jump on it. So if you are young & have good bones it would be great for you but I have a long row to hoe to get up to speed on it.
customer_reviews.author: schaits

customer_reviews.title: Broke during use in less then a month, luckily I avoided serious injuries.
customer_reviews.text: After about a month, when my boyfriend was rebounding one of the legs bent and collapsed. Thank god he is in good shape and he didn't hurt himself. However, I weigh more than him (less than 250lbs) and if I would fall down the way he did I would for sure have broken leg or arm. At first product seemed great until that happened. Can we please have the refund? We will need to order a stronger rebounder.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Leann

customer_reviews.title: Fun and functional
customer_reviews.text: I found this a snap (😆) to put together . I read some of the reviews and I was putting it together myself, someone suggested putting one end under a piece of heavy furniture so I put on half under my couch and snapped the other end open. Took 30 seconds. The whole setup took less than 10 minutes. I'm gonna have some fun with this.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Charters

customer_reviews.title: Little to no rebounding action
customer_reviews.text: There is little to no rebounding action. Springiness is almost none existent. Material is cheap. Just not a good product over all. You get less than you pay for because it useless for it’s intended use. As a matter of fact it is very uncomfortable to employ in its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set up not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Have not even been able to set this up. The diagrams and instructions are totally unclear, but they DO make it clear that the assembly process itself (let alone setting it up incorrectly) can cause "injury or death." If I can't figure this thing out by tomorrow, it's getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: A few minutes a day, on a rainy or snowy day, is all I need to get my brain focused. It's small yet well built, an can stand on it's edge to reduce the amount of floor space it takes up. I have reccomended this to several people, and I truly hope they have taken me up on it. I don't know where I'd be without this littel powerhouse. I live in Montana, so winters are very long. I didn't attach the arm pulls, I don't need the extra arm movement, so I can't comment on that. Highly recommend this trampoline.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S.

customer_reviews.title: Good trampoline, NOT conveniently foldable for storage
customer_reviews.text: Only three starts, because while not difficult to assemble, it is not fast to assemble either. I bought this product based on the description of easy fold for storage. To have it folded, there’s a need to pull it completely apart, that is unscrew the legs, remove the protective band that goes around everything, and last taking out the bolts for the folding itself. Just not worth the time it takes and since we have no space for an open trampoline, this product ended up being useless for us. Otherwise, it is a good trampoline-if you have the space for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Or

customer_reviews.title: Unsure how long this will last
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a lot for 3 months. It feels like it's more giving, like you can almost feel the floor at times at this point. I dont know how itll hold up. I'm around 170 and limit is 250 I think. I'm not easy on it either. Probably should've sprung for heavier duty.
customer_reviews.author: Laine

customer_reviews.title: Fun exercise
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice rebounder for the price. Amazing price actually. I found it fairly easy to put together. Instructions were clear/easy to follow. This is the first time I've used one of these. So after watching some videos about how to use it and the different exercises you can do....I tried it out. Running is a breeze. Making it a lot more fun than running on the treadmill. I like it and plan to use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: sharon keiser

customer_reviews.title: Also the bands are spaced so that friction won't be a problem but I do recommend you checking your specific item for this before
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the band trampoline to the springs. Springs are too loud. This one is a bit stiff for jumping, but it serves my purpose and it quiet. Also the bands are spaced so that friction won't be a problem but I do recommend you checking your specific item for this before use. I ordered a different brand trampoline with bands and they rubbed against the legs and hinges and the friction tore them after a couple months. This one seems much better made and is a lot lighter, so much easier to move.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Graham

customer_reviews.title: Down to the Last Jump
customer_reviews.text: We had ordered this trampoline in order to get some exercise while our gym was/is still closed for the lock down. After 3 months of use, the buoyant straps are beginning to tear leaving us touching the ground when we jump. The product was used for about an hour, 5 days a week over the past 3 months (ours was delivered April 1) so the product does show much wear with frequent use. We are anticipating another couple of weeks before the straps snap and the trampoline becomes unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt, Christie & Lynyrd

customer_reviews.title: STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and was worried I wouldn’t be able to open this myself, but I used my body weight to click it into to place no problem. I’m about 130 pounds and I do quite a bit of jumping on it ... works fine Only negative is I couldn’t fit the protective ring around the rebounder but I’m fine without it
customer_reviews.author: LTG

customer_reviews.title: Great way to tire out kids and adults!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trampoline for my 3 year old and myself. It was easy to assemble, just used my spouse's help to unfold it(did not want to be a casualty of rebound trampoline!!). My little one enjoys jumping on it and the size is just right.. not too big or small. I am on the heavier side and have done my share of jumps on the trampoline. It has held up well so far! Would definitely recommend to those who have very energetic kids. Great way to expend some of that energy!
customer_reviews.author: JB2006

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I opened it by myself...feet on one side, pushed down with my hands and body weight. Easy no, but I did it. (I'm 57) it is light enough to move where I want. And simple to use and yet I feel it! I use an elliptical every morning. And this thru out the day as I can. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: tt

customer_reviews.title: Very silent but hard to jump on it. But moving from side to side it was still very tiring. It can hold more than 300 pounds.
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most is that doesn’t make any noise. Very nice. Easy to assemble but you need TWO people!!!! It can hold more than 300 lb as long as you don’t jump on it. Moving side to side was easy on my knees and I was sweating a lot after few min. It is low to the ground. VERY stable. Very easy to step on and off. What I didn’t like is that I couln’t jump. Is too hard to jump on it.
customer_reviews.author: Norina Neacsu

customer_reviews.title: Great for older people and people who wants to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Very important for 3 days that I don't run (soccer) .On those days, I use rebounder twice a day each ~12min, ~1400 bounces, also my samsung gearfit I put it in exercise/running mode and it also measure same ~1400 steps, 0.8miles, ~100 calories , rebounding will heal all physical/health issues gradually. Great for older people and people who wants to get back to running after decades of not running! Also in my case, it is great for athletes to get the jogging that they need and strengthening and speed and agility that it enhances for me on the soccer field!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great rebounder for the price! Works great! I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on prime day as I had been wanting a re-bounder but didn't want to pay a whole lot for one either. Anyways this works great! Fun for the kid and myself. Bounce counter works well and also counts time spent. But you have to be heavier for it to count as it wouldn't count with kids use. Assembly wasn't too bad at all but you definitely need 2 people to set up as the instructions recommend because it's tough to push and hold down for proper assembly. I also am not the lightest person but not very heavy either, but I weigh close to 200 and this holds up well when I am bouncing and using it.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Good resistance. I am 120lbs. Wouldn't recommend for anyone near/over 200lbs. Nice size. Small enough to leave out and light enough to move out of the way. Bought it to exercise since I work from home. It's funny that my 6 year old son uses it constantly. It's great for kids to get that energy out. Dual purpose!!! I did break the counter off by jumping too close to the counter. A little super glue worked.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Woodley

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This rebounder is exactly as it's described. I had read reviews where people said the counter didn't work properly, but mine works wonderfully. It does take two strong men to open it up, but the rest of the assembly was fairly easy. It's very quiet and I really am enjoying it. I'm surprised at what a good workout it is. Gets my heart rate up very quickly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cayce B. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Stamina product. I purchased this item 3 1/2 months ago. Today I flipped it over to rest against the wall and discovered 3 of the straps were detached from the metal due to ripped seams. If it weren’t for that this item would be rated 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Ana W.

customer_reviews.title: Not A Happy Customer :-(
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed. I love shopping on Amazon, but this is one of the worst purchases I have ever made on the website. The counter hasn't worked properly since I set up the rebounder. You have to move in just the right spot, or it will not record your steps, time, etc. If it wasn't so difficult to put back in the box, I would return it. Years ago, I purchased another rebounder from a well known super store for 19.99. I wish I had saved my money and gone back to the store for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Eowyn89

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together. (I had my boyfriend help me after reading other reviews about it being difficult to open, we had no trouble). It is a good size and the perfect price for deciding if I want to get into rebounding as a regular fitness activity. I enjoy playing on it and getting a workout at the same time. My calves were pretty sore after my first time jumping. Make sure you stretch well before use. I have 4 stars only because I feel like it will probably wear out quickly and I just bought it. But at this price it was a GREAT buy.
customer_reviews.author: DanaSm

customer_reviews.title: This is only really good to try out rebounding
customer_reviews.text: Get what you pay for. This is only really good to try out rebounding. It lasted less than 4 months before the elastic straps started breaking. If you decide rebounded is something you want to stick with, you'll probably want to buy something more durable after this. If not, you've only spent $35 bucks or so finding out. My wife loves it, so now I'm looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff. After doing my research (which I should ...
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff. After doing my research (which I should have done first) I realise its because the rebounder is held by straps, not bungee cords. There is very little push back when I jump. I may as well do jumping jacks on the floor. Wondering if the straps loosen up with use...
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hite

customer_reviews.title: WAS perfect for a kid (UNTIL SAFETY SKIRT DIED)
customer_reviews.text: EDITED REVIEW: down from 5 stars to 2. The safety cover completely died. It ripped apart and disintegrated. Our kid didn't misuse this or jump on that part. It just didn't hold up. Now wondering if I can get a new skirt or if it's $40 wasted. :( ORIG REVIEW: My kid loves it! This is the perfect jumping while video game trampoline. It's saved our sofa. Not too huge for the living room, but big enough to bounce. It has good spring too, it's not too tight or stiff so he gets some air.
customer_reviews.author: Suruchi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this trampoline to start Rebounding workouts. So far I love it. So easy to put together. Some people said it was hard to push out and lay flat, but I didn't have a problem with it. I had my husband help me and hold one side and it easily snapped into position. Make sure to put the cover on BEFORE you screw in the legs, and put the handles on the legs too before you screw them in. Once you put it all together don't plan on taking it apart for storage...its way to much work.
customer_reviews.author: TNaz

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely a fun addition to my at home workout routine
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a fun addition to my at home workout routine. I'm not heavy, but my husband is over 200lbs and even he uses it from time to time and this trampoline holds his weight no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Funshoping

customer_reviews.title: Love bouncing! When it's too hot to go outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Love bouncing! When it's too hot to go outside or too late to take a walk, I get my Fitbit Steps by bouncing on my rebounder. Love the health benefits, size, and the fact that I can get my son to also do a little exercise before and after school to keep us both active. It's a great starter rebounder and let you really get a hang of it without making a huge investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Zaun

customer_reviews.title: Love it - just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I feel as if I'm getting a great workout from this. I didn't bother attaching the counter as my fitbit picks up the steps. I have arthritis and fibromyalgia and walking on my treadmill hurts my knees. This is a great way to get some exercise in without putting so much pressure on my knees and legs and even lets me jog a little which I can't do any other way without a lot of pain. My biggest problem is getting the chance to use it...2 of my dogs seem to think I bought them a new bed and they keep taking it over for their nap time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure there are vastly better products for a lot more money
customer_reviews.text: Has held me at 6ft3, 215-220 lbs for 3 months with no sign of wear. Held an even bigger buddy who visited and used it. I'm sure there are vastly better products for a lot more money. But this is going well for me and my rebounding game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the legs wasn’t threaded at all and therefore useless. At this point
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to using this but guess what? One of the legs wasn’t threaded at all and therefore useless. At this point, I could return it for a replacement and roll the dice on getting all the items needed to put this together or go with something else all together.
customer_reviews.author: sand

customer_reviews.title: Trampoline as described
customer_reviews.text: Have had now for about a month. Bounce is still good even after frequent use. I was able to put this together by myself (it might be easier with two people as suggested in other reviews but 1 person can do it). I’m happy with this trampoline and especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I have had this product for less than 3 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for less than 3 months and the straps that hold the mat over stretched and broke today. I am less than 120 lbs and that is the maximum weight that has ever been on the trampoline for normal rebounding. Although it says it can be used outdoors, I suspect it was exposure to the summer sun that rotted the straps....but in less than 3 months? Really pleased to update my review and report that Stamina products just called and were very accommodating and are replacing my mat free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: GratefulHeart

customer_reviews.title: Nice trampoline for at home gym on smoggy bad days
customer_reviews.text: Smaller , tramp with Resistant bands and counter. Doesn’t make all the noise that the spring versions make which is nice! Although it’s sold as a collapsible trampoline, I would not recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick801

customer_reviews.title: It's working Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that my grandson could get some exercising in on cold winter days while we were socially distanced from school. He loves it. Even through the summer he has used it when it is too hot to go outside. It seems to be holding up just great!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!  Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Elastic started to rip in less than a month. This wasn’t used hard. Advice- purchase another brand/style; this will not last. I contacted the manufacturer concerning the warranty , received 2 responses immediately but after sending them the requested pictures and information cannot get a response.
customer_reviews.author: Lyla.Beans

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Good rebounder.
customer_reviews.text: Like it, much better price than many others. It was took hard to unfold and put together. My husband handled it. There were two legs that were not properly threaded so he struggled a little with those. And the part that covers the springs doesn't fit perfectly. Nonetheless, for the price it cannot be beat and it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Astra Luna

customer_reviews.title: It has held up very well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this daily for exercise for several months now and it's still holding up very well. It hasn't stretched. I like that it's quiet. I'm not a heavy person, under 110 pounds, so a heavier person might have different results.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Pastor

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used this for a few days. It’s definitely difficult to unfold alone but my partner helped me to unfold it. Everything else is pretty easy to assemble. One of the legs is slightly bent inward so I hope that doesn’t cause a problem long term. Also, it does squeak when I jump on it. But I am enjoying jumping and working out on it so far. I’ll review again in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time is not useful, cuts off after a few seconds
customer_reviews.text: I should return it, very stiff! Not Bouncy, or rebounding. Seems very cheap, stretch cover came damaged. Time is not useful, cuts off after a few seconds. HRd to understand to change modes, but then quits & resets, losing all info.
customer_reviews.author: Karen's Bee Gluten Free

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I work out (jog, power walk, jump, etc) on this almost every day. This is a straight up great product. I’m 5’5” and 130 lbs and I put a lot of miles on this trampoline. It’s still like new and is holding up awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Geri Nicolai

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely a great value! Some challenges setting it up and people ...
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a great value! Some challenges setting it up and people really do need to be careful. We anchored one side down with a very heavy bench (an object that is stationary and will not move while the rebounder is opened. I don't see how anyone could collapse this for storage, if it is in regular use. Impractical, and maybe even dangerous. I would just store it under the bed or some other convenient place. We are leaving ours out in between uses because we have the room. My husband wasn't sure what to make of it, but now he also loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is the reason why we complain about items made in China! Day 1, while not even excising, the handle snapped in two. Not a problem for me, I didnt really want to use them. Day 12, the arm on the fitness counter broke off while exercising. Bigger problem as thats why I picked this rebounder. Now what a pain in the butt to have to pack this "thing" back up and send back! I felt comfortable using the trampoline part...but ALL the plastic pieces are as cheap as they make! What a shame this, like all the other made in china crap will end up in OUR landfill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looked good But didn’t last !!
customer_reviews.text: Got this about 3 weeks ago . Use it everyday for about 30mins (not continuously) and most elastic bands snapped. I’m a 125lbs 5’3” female so you do the math. Terrible DO NOT RECOMMEND !!!
customer_reviews.author: madelyn mendez

customer_reviews.title: The rebounder is well made sturdy and easy to assemble- I don't understand how someone ...
customer_reviews.text: The rebounder is well made sturdy and easy to assemble- I don't understand how someone could say they jumped on it a few times and it broke. I read positive reviews and some negative so I figured for the price it would not hurt to try it anyway. I am very pleased with it and have no issues what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gastelum

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP AND FUN TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Hey!! This little thing is giving me the aerobic exercise to FINALLLY have abs! I walk my dogs - slow - and lift weights - slow - but no abs decade after decade.... this great little trampoline I jump on maybe ten times a day for a minute to 4 minutes so far,,, really making a difference---- plus I hear "rebounding" is very important as people age
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Stretches
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old and I enjoy bouncing on this during the cold winter months when it's too cold to get outside to burn off some energy. We enjoy Simon Says in it but it seems to stretch out so it will get donated this spring. I'd like to add that I'm 200lbs so I'm sure that has a lot to do with the stretching. Other than that I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear74

customer_reviews.title: Travel friendly trampoline
customer_reviews.text: I like it. There is some difficulty when attempting to fold it up. There is an extra caution because it is a trampoline. It is a sturdy product and easily stored because it can be folded.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trampoline for the 2nd time. I decided to try the cloth straps vs real springs as replacing the springs was near impossible, and with my son not living with me anymore would be unable to replace them. My 2nd cloth"spring" lasted 7-8 months b4 I noticed the straps starting to fray and eventually break. I weight 125 lbs, and use it every day for 1`/2 hour to an hour. This 2nd one started breaking straps at 5 months of use. I have purchased expensive vs cheap, and it doesn't matter what you paay or springs vs cloth...buy cheap and often, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jo- McD

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Not too easy to fold but this is study and light so it is easy to move around. We bring it out to the family room when we want exercise and then hide it in the office when we don't. It is fun too. Helps keep you moving
customer_reviews.author: M. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Waste my money
customer_reviews.text: You need 2 strong people to put this together. I couldn’t get any help to do it. I had to put it out at the dumpster for someone else to figure out. Too complicated and difficult. Waste my money. Should have bought one at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Girl, please

customer_reviews.title: I got this for me an overweight 50 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for me an overweight 50 year old to reduce knee impact. However everyone in my house loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 and the first was super hard to assemble but the second was a breeze. It is a great but especially for small spaces. The additional accessories are very useful. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Pimpsinstitute

customer_reviews.title: Good for light exercise, and kids play.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trampoline to help with my lymphatic system. Rebounding is supposed to help your lymph system move the lymphatic fluid around. This trampoline works for that, but I think I will spend the extra money for a better one. After 10 min. on the rebounder my knees ache a little. It has now basically become the kids. They love it, and it has held up well for their play time. I would recommend it for kids, and for a little exercise. But if you want to do intense rebounding......spend the extra money.....your joints will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to make. Impossible to make?
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't put it together. It literally sits in the closet since 5 different people couldn't get it to open to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS TERRIBLE THING!
customer_reviews.text: This is so badly made, no bounce at all, the item is made to the lowest quality and is unsafe! Its not for anyone who is serious about working out and no use for anyone who just wants to pounce nicely, the thing is just the worst "rebounder" I have ever seen. Dont waster your time on such a badly made item. READ ALL THE REVIEWS CAREFULLY! That was my mistake. You can see that it just does not do the job at all. So disapointing and timewasting.
customer_reviews.author: g.carter lenette

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercise but does not bounce really high
customer_reviews.text: Great for exercise but does not bounce really high. I thought it was a great value but I wanted to use it as a prop for a musical where someone would bounce on it from higher up then do an acrobatic move and it just doesn't have enough bounce for that. I guess that is what you could expect from a smaller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used it yet. It just came in, we assembled it and guess what.... The resistant bands popped(just on testing it out). Wasted money thinking it was a slight upgrade and I could benefit from accessories.... So sad that I can't even use resistant bands that I paid for. Hate having to go through the hassle of a return...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher hernandez

product_meta.title: Stamina 38-Inch Intone Plus Rebounder
product_meta.description: The 38" Rebounder with resistance tubes, and electronic monitor is a fun way to build cardiovascular fitness, tone your legs, abs, buttocks, and back, have more energy, rev up your metabolism, and just feel, look, and be fit. The larger rebounding surface adds stability and more exercise options. The resistance tubes let you focus on building strength in your arms, shoulders, back and chest. The blue outline adds safety by keeping you bouncing inside the mat's 'sweet spont' area. The 38" Rebounder takes up a small amount of space and is easy to store out of the way when not in use.
feature_bullets: Large, durable heavy-duty polypropolene rebounding surface.
Two resistance tubes with foam padded handles for upper body strength training.
Motivational, multi-functional electronic fitness monitor tracks jumps per minute, workout time, total jumps and calories burned.
Optic blue border to help keep your workout safe. 38" wide sturdy steel frame.
Compact and portable. Ideal low-impact cardiovascular exercise for beginners or advanced fitness enthusiasts. Use indoors or outdoors. Safety pad.
The resistance tubes contain natural rubber latex which may cause allergic reactions

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
